title: Kled Champion Spotlight?
body:
Now I have refrained from commenting on Kled so far, as i don't have much experience with him and as don't like to make too wild accusations about champs that haven't even come out yet.

But after watching the Kled champion spotlight and noticed the distinct **LACK** of counterplay tips in it _(especially considering other champ's video's like Aurelion Sol's spend most of the video telling you that if you get inside his stars he's fucked, among many other counterplay tips)_, and after having played him on PBE, i am having serious doubts about how healthy this champ is going to be for the game. _(i will of course refrain from judgement until he comes out, but its hard to ignore what I'm seeing)_

He's an tanky AD duelling champion with AoE damage, 2x HP, no mana, lots of movement speed boosts, slows, AD scaling shields and dashes, and is sticky as fuck.

Also last time we gave an AD scaling shield to someone, it was Riven, and people have been complaining ever since, is it really wise to bring in another one?

-----------

In the spotlight video, they throw around a lot of words like "unstoppable" and "Deadly" and uses phrases like "when Kled charges in, someone's gunna die." and "has a better than average early game." But lacked any actual content regarding counters. _(short of happening to be Nami and ulting Kled's team while he is ulting you and while they are running exactly neck and neck with him in his ult, also while your whole team happens to be standing next to you while he ults so that you can 1v5 Kled without his team...) _ 

I don't know about you, but that 1 counterplay tip seems awfully specific to me, and unlikely to happen very often... _(and since when was 1v5ing a champion considered counterplay?)_

The "Better than average early game" worries me, because most AD champions, and Tanks, usually have bad early games (due to having such brutal late games) so it worries me that a champion who is **BOTH** AD and Tank has a 'stronger than average' early game.

So basically what I'm asking is: _**"RIOT can you please give us the counterplay tips that were absent in the video, so that tomorrow (or whenever patch day decides to come around) we aren't left with our trousers down."**_

replies.body:
>"when Kled charges in, someone's gunna die."

I think that statement may include Kled himself ; )

More seriously though, the Nami example is probably important because he can't physically stop his ult until he reaches an enemy champion or the end. Theoretically stopping his team from following in any way while he continues forwards can, and often will, lead to him being where he doesn't want to be. Beyond that only time (and any necessary patches) will tell really.

The problem with that is, it stops when he gets in range of any enemy champion AND it's an engage tool so his entire team CAN just follow him all the way assuming he isn't putting it somewhere stupid.

Because it is basically a Sivir ult on a tank.

Maybe it wasn't clear what I was referencing (the counterplay tip regarding Nami in the video). Using CC or zone control abilities to stop Kled's team from following him means that he continues on his way and ends up out of position. Sure, your team might be ultra coordinated and spread out and dodge everything thrown at them, most likely when charging down lane, but in the jungle it'll be more difficult to coordinate something like that.

Oh right, nevermind me then.

That said, add a Braum to Kled's team and watch as nothing stops them.
3 Kled games today, all noobs that fed.
Since Kled now has a passive which effectively helps him stack twice as much hp when he buys item that give HP if they'll revisit Sion's health stacking passive.

Why would they?

Sion's passive is Glory in Death. That has nothing to do with Kled.

His W Passive gives him 2 HP for every 1 unit slain... So what? Why would they change an ability passive (that isn't even his main passive)  just because another champion gets a completely different passive on release?

Sion is in a good spot, Kled probably isn't, why change Sion?
Good points. Better nerf Irelia again.

Hey dude,

So once again I am no expert but here are my thoughts on the champion from what I have seen so far!

It looks like Kled is a fighter - specifically a diver. He likes to go HAM. This means he will be pretty sturdy but not like a tank (Voli, malph etc). His tankiness/damage scale would be around Xin/Fiora is what I am expecting anyway.

From what I have seen already I believe this is how you play around Kled;

* Take advantage of his reduced mobility without Skaarl (he can't use Joust [E] when unmounted)
* His Q which is his main form of poke and slow is a skill shot so try to anticipate and dodge
* He excels when he goes HAM but this will put him out of position a lot, try to take advantage of this with ganks/ CC in team fights.
* When he is small do not let him bait you into a fight as Skaarl is going to come back.
* The above is also actually a cool opportunity, for Kled to be played well he will need to be risky and bait fights/all ins without Skaarl and try to get the bonus health before the fight is over. This means there is also an opportunity to burst him down before Skaarl comes back
* He's Melee so there's always lane phase advantages there
* Generally with Divers their biggest weaknesses come from kite and peel (Janna, Karma, Lux, Tristana). Any champions that focus on kiting and peeling will make Kleds life hard

Hope that helps!

Ahh ok, thank you! 

that'll help heaps.
